thread.title: Middlesbrough close in on Bojan signing and Aitor Karanka won't block Stewart Downing move
thread.title_full: Middlesbrough close in on Bojan signing and Aitor Karanka won't block Stewart Downing move

title: Middlesbrough close in on Bojan signing and Aitor Karanka won't block Stewart Downing move
text:
“I have always said that a player who is not happy here can leave” Aitor Karanka on Stewart Downing 
Karanka is looking to refashion his forward line this month having already signed Rudy Gestede from Aston Villa and sold David Nugent to Derby. 
Jordan Rhodes will also move on with Downing been deemed surplus to requirements just 18 months after making a sentimental return to Boro. 
Downing played some of the best football of his career under Sam Allardyce at West Ham and would jump at the chance of a reunion with former manager. 
GETTY Stewart Downing could be heading to Crystal Palace 
He’s started just three of Boro’s last 13 games and Bojan’s imminent arrival would see him fall further down the pecking order. 
Karanka will not stand in his way even if it would represent a gamble letting him play for another team scrapping it out at the foot of the table. 
He said: “If the club that wants him agrees with our club, then it will not be a problem for me,” he said. 
“I have always said that a player who is not happy here can leave. 
“I don’t want to think about what scenario is better or worse – Crystal Palace or a Championship team– because at the moment, I don’t know anything on that score. 
“But I take every single decision here. I have all responsibilities.” Related articles
